page.title: 07VILLAGE HALL, UFFCULME
page.content: The{Village Hall}was built originally as a Church School. It was sold by the Church to a Village Committe in 1975. Alterations were made between 1978 and 1980 to improve the facilities. It now has a main hall and stage with a number of different stage lights. These are used mainly by UADS {( Uffculme Ameatuer Dramatic Society) and{Uffculme Primary School}for stage productions. Added on to this ,the original building, are dressing rooms at the rear, a store room at the side and a kitchen and coffee bar overlooking the lawns and pond to the south. The Playgroup, UADS and the Over-60's all have regular bookings here and many other{Village Events}and {Fetes etc.}are held here annually. Income just about pays for day to day running costs. Lack of space will prevents further expansion in size.
